stories.text:
We're building a wearable EEG to improve sleep performance, and our unit economics look quite good, but I keep hearing about challenges in hardware from companies that have 70%+ markup on their hardware.

What am I missing or not understanding?
stories.title: Ask HN: Hardware startup? What surprised you about forecasting your business?

stories.text: In theory, it would be uneconomical to own a car and you could commute just about anywhere as fast as a subway ride, cheap as a bus ticket, and comfortably as an UberXL. How will this change cities and transportation?
stories.title: Ask HN: How will driverless electric taxis change socities?
Probing political bias on Twitter with drifter bots (2021)
Ordinary copper telephone wire could carry gigabit broadband speeds

stories.text:
How come I can’t buy a device where I can download or edit clothing designs, feed some linen and fabric material into a machine, and have it “print” out clothes for me?

Is it just too difficult to program machines to do that? Or is clothing production contingent on other factors besides just sewing together fabric?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why aren’t there “3D printers” for clothing?
